text: hello everyone
today I want to discuss a feature of the
Amazon inspector which has been launched
in preview
code scans for AWS Lambda functions
you can use this feature to start
scanning custom application code in your
Lambda functions in layers
written in programming languages like
Java Python node.js and go for code
button abilities
this expands on Amazon inspectors
previously released feature Lambda
standard scanning
but before I begin let me start with a
brief overview of the service
Amazon inspector is an automated
vulnerability Management Service
with just a few clicks the service can
be enabled across a single account or
the entire organization
it's then automatically starts
discovering easy to workloads container
images that reside in Amazon elastic
container registry
and AWS Lambda functions in layers in
the enabled accounts
it continuously scans these workloads
for any software vulnerabilities and
unintended Network exposure
the generated findings are routed out to
AWS security hub and Amazon eventbridge
which can be utilized for building out
automation workflows
now let's discuss scanning Lambda
functions in more detail
there are two types of Lambda scales
available Lambda standard scanning and
Lambda code scanning which is in preview
so what's the difference between the two
Lambda standard scanning is the default
it scans application dependencies within
the Lambda function and its layers for
any package vulnerabilities
where is Lambda code scanning can also
scan the custom application code for any
code vulnerabilities
until now customers had to rely on
third-party tools for analyzing
vulnerabilities in their Lambda
functions
with this new feature you can
continuously scan your Lambda based
serverless compute workloads as well
Amazon inspector does not require any
agents or libraries to be installed for
Lambda scanning
customers have an option to enable just
the standard scanning or enable it along
with code scanning
so when does the second get initiated
the service will trigger evaluation
initially at deployment and then
automatically rescans when there is a
function change or when a new
vulnerability is published
now let me get into my AWS console and
show you how to enable this feature
how the service automatically starts
scanning and discovering Lambda
functions and then review some findings
I have browsed to Amazon inspector
service in my console
now let's see how to enable Lambda
scanning
under settings
select account management
here under activate
select AWS Lambda standard scanning plus
AWS Lambda code scanning to enable both
the options
as you will notice I just enabled it on
a single account
but you can do the same across all the
accounts in your organization as well
it will take a couple of minutes to
activate so let me pause the video for a
few minutes and come back
feature has been activated now let's
browse back to the dashboard and see if
there is Lambda scan information
available
as you can see inspector automatically
started discovering and scanning Lambda
functions in the account
you can click on this Lambda coverage
percentage to get a more detailed View
and you can see the list of Lambda
functions in your environments and their
scan status
now let me take a minute to talk about
the criteria to be eligible for a scan
besides running on a supported runtime
the function should have been invoked or
updated in last 90 days
it should be marked with the version
latest and you should not have
specifically excluded a function from
scan using tag inspector exclusion
now you can click on individual function
to review their findings I will move
down to the code scanning section
click on scanning and then choose my
demo Lambda
as you can see inspector automatically
discovered my python based demo Lambda
detected code vulnerabilities and
generated these findings
now I can click on an individual finding
and review the code that generated this
binding and also suggested remediation
steps
and that's it in this video we've
discussed the new preview feature of
Amazon inspector using which you can
start scanning your Lambda function code
for Walden abilities
this feature is also available for a 15
day free trial so do give it a try
